entries.13021301:
If you have fought him, and were imprisoned, you must know that
Seath is a true Undead, different from ourselves.
entries.13021302:
His wounds close promptly, and no mortal blow affects him,
granting true insulation from death.
entries.13021303:
It is an effect of the Primordial Crystal, a sacred treasure
pillaged by Seath when he turned upon the ancient dragons.
entries.13021304:
So, only by destroying the Primordial Crystal can you so much as
scratch his hide.

And it so happens, the Primordial Crystal is in the inner garden
of these very archives, the Crystal Forest.

seem to find your share of trouble.

hole!

entries.28001508: Show me that you can defeat it.

For if you cannot defeat the Darkwraith, you will be no match for

But I am the Guardian of the Seal. I have seen too many lives

entries.28001802: So, I had no choice but to test your mettle.
entries.28001900: You, you have defeated the Darkwraith!
entries.28001901: Very good, indeed. I can certainly trust you.

entries.28001903: The Four Kings slumber in the deepest chamber of the ruins.

entries.28001907: But the Abyss is no place for ordinary mortals.
entries.28001908: Although long ago, the knight Artorias traversed the Abyss.

If you can find him, and learn from him, the Abyss may prove
surmountable.
entries.28002000: I am the Guardian of the Seal.

entries.28002002:
The Darkwraiths are the enemies of man, and any living thing that
has a soul.
entries.28002003:
They were born in New Londo, and that is where they perished; the

entries.28002004: ...For that is how great a threat they were...

entries.28002101:
Mark my words. The Darkwraiths are the enemies of man, and any

Long ago, the Four Kings were powerful men. Only, their hearts
were weak.
entries.28002201: When an evil serpent dangled the art of Lifedrain before them,
entries.28002202: they were unable to resist, and became pawns of evil.
entries.28002305: You are no different from the rest...

entries.29000202: If you notice durability running low, it's time to repair.

You can ask a blacksmith like meself, or do it on your own with a
grindstone.

entries.29000205: So, pay them a little respect, eh?
entries.29000300:
There are two types of weapon forging. There's reinforcement, and
there's ascension.
entries.29000301:
Reinforcement is simple. It strengthens the weapon and nothing
more.
entries.29000302:
A simple task for any blacksmith. Hell, you could even do it
yourself with a smithbox.
entries.29000303: But ascension's a finer art. It alters a weapon's properties.
entries.29000304:
Ascension is the territory of we blacksmiths; a smithbox just
won't do the trick.
entries.29000305:
Start out with reinforcement. When that loses its charm, you can
consider ascension.
entries.29000306: As you've noticed, this land is flush with the mad and wicked.
entries.29000307:
You won't make it through the night without employing my
services!
entries.29000400: You can forge armour just like you do weapons.
entries.29000401:
Reinforcement is easy enough. You only need a smithbox. But
ascension is the territory of we blacksmiths.
entries.29000402: Forging armour is even easier than forging weapons.
entries.29000403:
Whether you forge weapons or armour first? Well, that's up to
you.
entries.29000404: But nobody wants to see you go Hollow.
entries.29000405: So, whatever you do, you'd better do it well!
entries.29000501: It was abandoned in favour of the church that you passed through.

Fortress, and the Darkroot Garden.

They attract all sorts of lunatics, no-one as cultured as

Sen's Fortress is an old proving grounds built by the ancient
gods.

entries.37000700: How did that silly sorcerer's apprentice end up?

entries.37000702: He left for the Undead Burg, but never came back.
entries.37000703:
Serves him right. If even Old Big Hat can't make it out there,
what chance does he have?
entries.37000704: I hope he enjoys his new life as a Hollow.
entries.37000800: How did that raggedy old chum end up?
entries.37000801: You know, the one who idolized some godmother of pyromancy.
entries.37000802: He left for Blighttown, but never came back.
entries.37000803: Whereas most flee from sickness, he dives right in.
entries.37000804: Well, nothing will harm him once he goes Hollow.
entries.37000901: I never know what the Gods are thinking...
entries.37001000: How did that nutty sorcerer make it back?
entries.37001001: Unexpected, but I suppose stranger things have happened.
entries.37001100: How did that old man make it back?
entries.37001101: Unexpected, but I suppose stranger things have happened.
entries.37001200: Don't you ever think to forge your weapons?
entries.37001201:
Perhaps you haven't heard of Andre. Visit him in the Old Church,
in the forest behind the Undead Church.
entries.37001202: Perhaps you haven't heard of Andre. You really need to find him.
entries.37001203: Unless you enjoy swinging about with blunt instruments!
entries.37001300: Oh, have you seen that terribly morose lass?
entries.37001302: She's stuck keeping that bonfire lit.
entries.37001303: Sad, really. She's mute and bound to this forsaken place.
entries.37001304:
They probably cut her tongue out back in her village, so that
she'd never say any god's name in vain.
entries.37001305:
How do these martyrs keep chugging along? I'd peter out in an
instant.
entries.37001400: Oh, your face! You're practically Hollow.
entries.37001401:
It won't be long, if you keep dying like this. You'd best hurry
and restore your humanity.
entries.37001402: But who knows, going Hollow could solve quite a bit!
entries.37001501: Well, there are a few ways to go about it...
entries.37001502: Collect it bit by bit from corpses,
entries.37001503:
Collect it bit by bit from corpses, or you can butter up a
cleric, and get yourself summoned.
entries.37001504:
And the quickest way, although I'd never do it, is to kill a
healthy Undead, and pillage its humanity.
entries.37001505: Coveting thy neighbour is only human, after all!
entries.37001601: Don't try anything clever. You might regret it.
entries.37001700: Oi, hold on...Don't tell me, have you been cursed?
entries.37001701:
Oh woe is the Undead who's cursed on top of it all! Harsh times;
harsh times, indeed!
entries.37001704: No, no, I'm sorry. Here, let me share a nice tip.
entries.37001705: Long ago, I was told of a remedician who resides in New Londo.
entries.37001706: Does he really exist? Well, go and find out for yourself.
entries.37001707: But don't blame me if he's just an apparition!
entries.37001800: Big Hat Logan, the legendary sorcerer, in the flesh!
entries.37001801:
...This place is simply mad...Legendary heroes popping up left
and right...
entries.37001802: They're making me feel quite inadequate, to be honest!
entries.37001901: That virtuous little maiden, complete with followers in tow.
entries.37001902:
They're probably going straight to pillage graves. I've heard
enough about "M'Lady" for a lifetime.
entries.37002000: Did you hear about the maiden?
entries.37002001: The virtuous lass came back alone, and in absolute tatters...
entries.37002002: Did her followers die, or was she abandoned? Who knows.
entries.37002003: But I suppose we've heard the last from "M'lady".
entries.37002101: She's shuffled off somewhere. I believe to the Undead Church.
entries.37002102: These ruins were probably too awkward for her.
entries.37002200: Did you ring the second bell?
entries.37002201: That is incredible, I must say...But now we have a new problem.
entries.37002202: It's noisy, it snores, and its breath is lethal...
entries.37002203: This is no laughing matter, I tell you.
entries.37002300: Damn, that stench...And I was really beginning to like it here!
entries.37002302: Maybe it's time I do something about it...
entries.37002401: There's nothing to speak about, really.
entries.37002403:
That crow flew off with somebody in its clutches. I think it was
a man curled up in a ball.
entries.37002501: I'm not up for chatting. Leave me alone.
entries.37002600: Well, what are you going to do?
entries.37002602: I don't really care; I'm simply crestfallen...
entries.37002800: Lousy rat! You have some nerve!
entries.37002801: I may be crestfallen, but I'm not defenceless, you rascal!
entries.37002901: I think you've done me a favour...
entries.37003001: How'd you let me do that to you?
entries.37003100: Don't you ever think to forge your weapons?
entries.37003101: You'd better find a smithbox soon,
entries.37003102: Unless you enjoy swinging about with blunt instruments!
entries.37003104: Don't you ever repair your weapons?
entries.37003105: You just need the right tools, or some powder.
entries.37003106:
If you keep swinging those scraps around, you'll be mistaken for
a Hollow!
entries.38000102: Forgive me. I was absorbed in thought.
entries.38000104: Quite honestly, I have run flat up against a wall.
entries.38000105: Or, a gate, I should say. The thing just won't budge.
entries.38000106: No matter how long I wait. And, oh, have I waited!
entries.38000107: So, here I sit, in quite a pickle.
entries.38000108: Weighing my options, so to speak!
entries.38000501: Well, I'm certainly not backing down!
entries.38000502: By the honour of my knighthood!
entries.38000702: Ahh, where did you come from? Splendid news, I tell you.
entries.38000703: First, I hear a great roar. And, voila! The path is open.
entries.38000704: Just goes to show. Good things come to those who wait!
entries.38000800: Mn, mmm...Ah, so you see my plight?
entries.38000801: Yes, indeed, I have run up against a wall.
entries.38000803: ...I'm afraid I'm a bit too plump to be outrunning those things.
entries.38000804: So, here I sit, in quite a pickle.
entries.38000805: But who knows? Perhaps we'll have another development?
entries.38000900: Perhaps I could try some rolling...
entries.38000901: ...Bah, no chance. My head would spin.
entries.38010101: Let me guess. Were you repelled by the Silver Knights?
entries.38010102: Aww, don't be ashamed. 'Tis the fate of vanguards like you and I.
entries.38010103: I'll think of something. We can overcome this, together!
entries.38010201: We'll need another three, no, maybe five bodies...
entries.38010304:
Fantastic...I am saved. This knight of Catarina hereby commends
you!
entries.38010305: Take this, as a token of my gratitude.
entries.38010306: But be warned, gallantry entails great risks.
entries.38010307: Next time, give me a chance to come up with a plan.
entries.38020002: There you are! What a pleasure!
entries.38020003: Well, look at me. Trapped like a mouse.
entries.38020004: But, don't lose any sleep over me.
entries.38020005: I'm very focused, sitting here, so very still.
entries.38020006: Something good is bound to happen soon!
entries.38020100: I require a key to exit.
entries.38020101: But the key is on the outside...
entries.38020300: Ahh! There you are! Bless you!
entries.38020301: You seem to help me at every turn.
entries.38020302: This knight of Catarina expresses his deepest gratitude.
entries.38020303: Please take this, as a token of my appreciation.
entries.38020304: I didn't expect you to show up.
entries.38020401: I'm going to take it slowly here, at least for now.
entries.38020402: After all this time, it's not so intolerable.
entries.38020403: I've actually become quite fond of it!
entries.38030102: Forgive me. I was absorbed in thought.
entries.38030104: Quite honestly, I have run up against a wall.
entries.38030105: Perhaps you've noticed those bug-eyed lizards?
entries.38030106: I've had a go at them, but their breath is petrifying.
entries.38030107: And so here I am, just thinking things over!
entries.38030108: Any moment now, and I'll be hit by an epiphany!
entries.38030202: Forgive me. I was absorbed in thought.
entries.38030203: Perhaps you've noticed those bug-eyed lizards?
entries.38030204: I've had a go at them, but their breath is petrifying.
entries.38030205: And so here I am, just thinking things over!
entries.38030206: Any moment now, and I'll be hit by an epiphany!
entries.38030301: Ahh, I thought not. This is a difficult one, even for me...
entries.38030303: Perhaps I should aim for their eyes...
entries.38030404: Ahh, you went for the eyes! I knew it...
entries.38030405: I am saved. This knight of Catarina thanks you sincerely.
entries.38030406: Please take this, as a token of my gratitude.
entries.38030407: But be warned, gallantry entails great risks.
entries.38030408: Next time, give me a chance to come up with a plan.
entries.38040102: Excuse me. I was so absorbed in thought, I just drifted away.
entries.38040103: You see, I'm actually in a bit of a fix.
entries.38040104:
I've made it this far, but I'm short on antitode moss for the
trip back.
entries.38040106: By my knighthood, I am ashamed to ask...
entries.38040107: But can you spare a few scraps of moss?
entries.38040121: Thank you, a saint you are.
entries.38040122:
This knight of Catarina expresses his deepest gratitude. I shall
not forget this.
entries.38040123: Please, take this; a symbol of my appreciation.
entries.38040124: Well, our fates do seem entwined, don't they?
entries.38040125: Perhaps this, too, is the will of Lord Gwyn!
entries.38040142: I'll be fine. I can make it without that silly moss.
entries.38040143: Think about it. Have I ever let a little hardship slow me down?
entries.38060102: Excuse me. I was so absorbed in thought, I just drifted away.
entries.38060103: It must be the warmth. Well, what's on your mind?
entries.38060104: No, don't tell me. Those monsters making life difficult for you?
entries.38060105: You need not be ashamed. We are in the same boat.
entries.38060106: ...You know, I really have run up quite a debt to you.
entries.38060201: Friend, I have an idea. A good one, really.
entries.38060202:
...I will rush those dire fiends, and you can slip away in the
confusion.
entries.38060203: Please, friend, I owe you much more than this.
entries.38060204: By the honour of the knights of Catarina, allow me to assist you.
entries.38060205: And now, I go! Don't be slow!
entries.38060224: I am Siegmeyer of Catarina, and you shall feel my wrath!
entries.38060302: Wait!...Did you defeat those dire creatures?
entries.38060304: Well, wonderful. This knight of Catarina thanks you.
entries.38060305: Take this, as a token of my gratitude.
entries.38060306: I feel like I'm always thanking you...
entries.38060401: Why, you! Didn't you get away?
entries.38060402: Well, you've saved me, once again...
entries.38060403: Dear me, what can I say? I have failed you...
entries.38060501: But, you! Didn't you get away?
entries.38060502: Well, you've saved me, once again...
entries.38060504: I think I'll have a rest.
entries.38060505: Don't you worry, the ground below me is my pillow.
entries.38070001: You did much for me up above. I am grateful.

entries.38070021: It seemed like an unlikely coincidence.
entries.38070022:
Well, am I fortunate! This knight of Catarina thanks you
sincerely.
entries.38070023: Please take this, as a token of my gratitude.
entries.38070041: Hmm, no matter. Stranger things have happened.
entries.38070042: Sometimes one only has to give it some time.
entries.38070101: I'll be heading down below shortly.
entries.38070103: No worries! Adventuring is my life; I'm prepared for the worst.
entries.38070201: I owe you much. I was hoping that you would come.

So that I could say thank you, for saving me. From one brave
knight to another.
entries.38070203: Please, take this, as a token of my gratitude.
entries.38070204: This is a relief. Now I have no regrets.
entries.38070205: I shall depart for my final adventure...
entries.38070301: I am preparing for my final adventure.
entries.38070302: Wherever you go, may you be safe.
entries.38070303: You are a true hero, to be sure.

...to deliver her mother's last words...And the poor girl's not
even Undead!
entries.38070404: Heavens, I never asked her to do that...
entries.39000000: It was you who rescued me? Why, thank you.
entries.39000002: I don't know how I ended up in that crystal...
entries.39000003: It wasn't terrible in there, but I could hardly move.
entries.39000004: I must think of some way to repay you.
entries.39000100: Oh! Have you seen my father?
entries.39000101: You wouldn't miss him. A suit of armour, just like mine?
entries.39000120: Thank goodness! I knew he was here somewhere.
entries.39000121: Well then, now I must find him. Thanks again, truly.
entries.39000122: Now if he'll just stay put, and keep out of trouble.
entries.39000140: Yes, I see...But if you should happen to bump into him,
entries.39000141:
tell him that Sieglinde is on her way, and that he ought to just
stay put.
entries.39000301: You are one of the bad ones.
entries.39000302: Then, there's only one thing to do with you.
entries.39000500: Rest assured. I will kill you as many times as it takes.
entries.39020001: We're both managing quite well, aren't we?
entries.39020002: But I haven't found my father yet. Have you seen him?
entries.39020003: Really! Then I must be off.
entries.39020004:
I'm sorry he's caused you trouble...He has a knack for that. If
he'd just stay put...
entries.39020005: Yes, I see. Well, I had to ask.
entries.39020006: I will continue searching a bit longer. Thank you so much.
entries.39020101: I have finally located my father.
entries.39020102: All of your help was invaluable to us...Thank you so much.
entries.39020103: I was finally able to pass on my mother's last words.
entries.39020200: My father? He went on his final adventure.
entries.39020201:
Don't worry, that's just the way he is. Undead or no. Sort of
reassuring, really.
entries.39020202: If he goes Hollow, I'll just have to kill him again.
entries.39030000:
My father...all Hollow now...has been subdued. He will cause no
more trouble.
entries.39030001: It's finally over...I will return to Catarina.
entries.39030002: You assisted us both greatly. I can hardly return the favour,
entries.39030003: but please accept this. It's of no use to me now.
entries.40000001: Then I am in luck. Could you help me?
entries.40000002: As you can see I am stuck, without recourse.
entries.40000020: I entreat you. Have pity on this powerless knight.
entries.40000021: Surely you can imagine the depth of such dejection?
entries.40000040:
Please, I have duties to fulfil, and I will reward you
handsomely.
entries.40000041: Well? I am certain you stand to benefit.
entries.40000061: Do not run away! Hear me out!
entries.40000081: I beg of you. Help me.
entries.40000101: I am Knight Lautrec of Carim.
entries.40000102: I truly appreciate this, and I guarantee a reward, only later.
entries.40000200: Yes, very sorry, your reward will have to wait.
entries.40000201: I have just been freed. Allow me some time.
entries.40000220: I am free. Now I can get back to work...
entries.40000360: Keh keh keh. Are you sure about this?
entries.40000401: I was once grateful to you,
entries.40000402: But if this is our fate, so be it!
entries.40010001: I have your reward. Please accept it.
entries.40010002: I am grateful to you. For freeing me...
entries.40010004: ...Not enough for you? Well, let's not be greedy, now...
entries.40010022: Hmmm... Your humanity is really slipping.
entries.40010023:
But there are methods. Most fools have more humanity than they
know what to do with.
entries.40010024: Now, who do you imagine will make the best use of it, hmm?
entries.40010081: I am glad to see you are safe.
entries.40010100: Hm, you again? What is it?
entries.40010102: Our futures are murky. Let's not be too friendly, now.
entries.40010121: I'm considering a change of location...
entries.40010122: I have a rather, pressing matter to attend to up above.
entries.40010123: That Keeper has served me well, but...enough with her...
entries.40010141: How dare you come prancing about!
entries.40010142: I have nothing to say. Be gone from my sight.
entries.40010161: I am Knight Lautrec of Carim.
entries.40010162: We are both Undead. Perhaps we can help one another.
entries.40010180: Hmm, what business do you have?
entries.40010181: If you have none, then stay silent.
entries.40010200: Ahh, you certainly are keeping busy.
entries.40010201: Care to pay for a useful tip?
entries.40010221: Maiden Thorolund and her followers recently arrived in this land,
entries.40010222: but she became stranded deep below the Catacombs.
entries.40010223:
Her followers either fled, or were reduced to Hollows...Leaving
Maiden Thorolund all alone.
entries.40010224:
Not a bad tip, huh? A nubile cleric would be replete with
humanity...
entries.40010241: Well, suit yourself. Only trying to help.
entries.40010260: Hm? That tip I gave you?
entries.40010261: Ahh, I heard it from a fleeing old man.
entries.40010262: That poor bastard! All his robes and trinkets won't help him now!
entries.40020000: Why, you...How far will you come?!
entries.40020002: What have I done to you?
entries.40020102: Then I have no choice! You will regret this!
entries.40020103: How dare you insult Lautrec the Embraced!
entries.40020104: May the Goddess have Mercy upon you.
entries.40020202: I thought you were wiser, but I thought wrong!

entries.40020204: You fellows? No? Don't you agree?
entries.40020302: How many times will these lambs rush to slaughter?
entries.40020303: Well, let's get it over with.
entries.40020400: Have you heard of Trusty Patches?
entries.40020401: If ever a man has rubbed me up the wrong way, ugh!
entries.40020402: If he ever comes around again, I swear, I'll have his hide.
entries.41000001: I'm Shiva of the East, captain of the brigade.
entries.41000002: Let's teach you the clan basics now,
entries.41000003: as there is no time to chat in the midst of fighting.
entries.41000004: Except there's little in the form of rules, you hear?
entries.41000005:
Fight and hunt as you like. Whoever's fastest gets the prey.
That's the way we do it.
entries.41000006:
Only...Don't forget what Alvina said. Traitors aren't given a
second chance, for any reason.
entries.41000008: Don't worry, it's a good old time, isn't it?
entries.41000009: Great to have you with us. Good hunting to you.
entries.41000100: Ah, did you notice that one? Sharp eyes!
entries.41000101: He's one of the clan. From the East, like myself.
entries.41000102: Always slinking in the shadows, but he's a tough one.
entries.41000201: You'll be called in soon enough.
entries.41000202: Hunters with patience score the best kills.
entries.41000400: Turning on us from the very start?
entries.41000401: You have some guts, to turn on us!
entries.41000402: Have a look at my sword, for it's the last thing you'll see!
entries.41000601: You won't be able to run far enough...
entries.41000701: Don't you ever come round again.
entries.41010001: Strange to meet away from the clan and the forest.
entries.41010002: But while you're here, how about some equipment?
entries.41010003: I love collecting these things, but I can only keep so many.
entries.41010004: And, you know, you are a friend. I'll sell them cheap.
entries.41010101: I have the equipment, if you have the need.
entries.41010201: I've culled my best picks from my last summoning.
entries.41010300: I see you have a sharp eye for trinkets.

entries.41010400: Right then. I'll see you in the forest.
entries.41010500: Right then. I'll be seeing you.
entries.41010600: Have you heard of Chaos Blade?
entries.41010601:
The legendary sword of the ancient Undead master Makoto, its
blade a swirling vortex.
entries.41010602: I heard it's somewhere around here, but I can't find it.
entries.41010603: ...It's all I could ever wish for...
entries.41010702: Your sword! Is it not... the Chaos Blade...?
entries.41010703: I've been searching for her for ages!
entries.41010704:
...I beg of you, and I promise repay you...Will you give the
sword to me?
entries.41010801: As promised, this is for you. Go ahead, take it.
entries.41010802:
Ahh, splendid, the Chaos Blade...Look into the

entries.41010806: Can't be known without a good killing...
entries.41010900: ...Yes, quite alright, I cannot blame you.
entries.41010901: The blade is yours, after all.
entries.41010902: ...So, I will do the honourable thing...
entries.41011000: Don't you run away! Be still you rat!

entries.41011100: This is what you get for crossing me.
entries.41011101: Have a look at my sword, for it's the last thing you'll see!
entries.41011301: You won't be able to run far enough...
entries.41011400: What a wonderful specimen...Like slicing through butter...
entries.41011500: Your ambitions have sealed your fate.
entries.41011501: But, who'd have thought I'd be the traitor?
entries.41011502: Sometimes you never know, do you...
entries.42000000: Good day! You look reasonably sane!
entries.42000001:
What are you doing in the Catacombs? Are you a cleric or
something?
entries.42000021:
Best of luck with your pilgrimages or missions or whatever you
do.
entries.42000022: This place is treacherous. Do watch your step, eh?
entries.42000041:
Ohhh, I know what it is. You've come for the trinkets, haven't
you?
entries.42000043: This place is treacherous. Do watch your step.

Enough with the chit-chat. In a place like this, we need to stay

entries.42000200: Ah, oh! Well, well, how are you, then?
entries.42000201: I, uh, sort of lost my way, yes...
entries.42000202: But when I came here, I didn't touch any levers, no, not me!
entries.42000203: Very peculiar, isn't it? Wait, did something happen to you?
entries.42000204:
Hey, don't look at me like that. I'm Trusty Patches, the

entries.42000205: Here, everything's good with us, eh? Aww, c'mon, take it!
entries.42000206: Heh heh. We'll be wonderful friends.

entries.42000402: ...It didn't cause you any trouble, by chance?
entries.42000501: Well, that's a fine shame. Oh, I'm truly sorry, really!
entries.42000502: But, wait now, you didn't actually fall down, then?

entries.42000604: You and I, just a couple of Undead outcasts, right my darling?
entries.42000700: Oh, will you come off it, now!

entries.42000905: You lousy good-for-nothing! Wallow in your spit!

entries.42001301: Well, if that's what it has to be! Why you...
entries.42001501: Curses, you left me no choice...
entries.42010000: Good day! You look reasonably sane!

What are you doing in the Catacombs? Are you a cleric or

I owe you for all that, er, praying and what not...I'll give you

entries.59000110: We are both strangers in this strange land.
entries.59000120: But, at least now there are two of us.
entries.59000220: We ought to help one another out.
entries.59000310: Think of anything that you might need?
entries.59000410: Put some spring into your step!
entries.59000510:
What ever's the matter? No, I can tell. 
You need me more than ever.
entries.59000800: Did you happen across Knight Artorias?
entries.59000810: The legendary Abysswalker, from the old tales.
entries.59000820: ...Well, if you haven't, it's just as well...
entries.59000830: He's a colourless sort, if you ask me.
entries.59000900: Did you really slay Knight Artorias?
entries.59000910:
I'd heard the Abyss found him first,
but even still...
entries.59001000: So, what did that giant mushroom make you do?
entries.59001010: Not that I care. It's none of my business.
entries.59001020: But I do wonder about those sorceries of hers...
entries.59001100: Hm? I've little to talk about, really.
entries.59001110: Oh, you know me. What do I know?
entries.59001200: What? If you've something to say, then say it!
entries.59001210: Just don't say the wrong thing...
entries.59001310: You have quite some nerve. Or are you just thick?
entries.59001320: Fine, then. What is it that you need?
entries.59001610: Oolacile has brought the Abyss upon itself.
entries.59001620:
Fooled by that toothy serpent,
they upturned the grave of primeval man,
and incited his ornery wrath.
entries.59001630: What could they have been thinking?
entries.59001640: But to you and I, it's all ancient history.
entries.59001650: You have to ask yourself. Does it really matter?
entries.59005000: Oh! It's come to blows, has it?
entries.59005010: Fine, then. I've had enough of you, anyway!
entries.59005100: What now? You think this my fault?
entries.59005110: How very, very petty of you!
entries.59005400: What? Now you're feeling the heat?
entries.59005410: You should have thought long and hard...
entries.59005420: Before you sided with a bloody mushroom!
entries.59005510: I am Marvellous Chester! What did you expect?
entries.60000010: ...Why have you the ring of Artorias?
entries.60000011: ...Why have you the soul of Artorias?
entries.60000020: ...I am Ciaran, and that is a keepsake.
entries.60000110: It was purloined by a man in a long coat...
entries.60000120: I know not how you came upon it,
entries.60000130: but its owner met his death here.
entries.60000140:
He was a dear companion,
and I wish to return the ring to his grave.
entries.60000150: Would you be willing to part with it?
entries.60000200: Thank you. You are very kind.
entries.60000210: Please take this. I no longer need it.
entries.60000500: ...Then you have no business with me...
entries.60000620: I am here to pay respects to a dear friend.
entries.60000630: Please, allow me a moment alone.
entries.60000710: The soul of the man who fell on this spot?
entries.60000720: He was a dear friend. I wish to pay proper respect, with that soul.
entries.60000730: Would you be willing to part with it?
entries.60005010:
...always taking what you please.
Then, I shall do the same.
entries.60005011:
...always resorting to force.
Then, I shall do the same.
entries.60005210:
How did you imagine that
the Lord's Blade would not reach you?
entries.61000010:
From what far-away age hast thou come?
Thy scent is very human, indeed.
entries.61000030:
Ah, Princess Dusk's saviour.
Thine aura is precisely as she described.
entries.61000031:
Princess Dusk has spoken of thee.
Thy aura is precisely as she described.
entries.61000040:
I thank thee deeply,
for rescuing Her Highness.
entries.61000050: But Princess Dusk is here no longer...
entries.61000060: ...snatched away by that horrifying primeval human.
entries.61000070:
And so I must ask...
Couldst thou once more play the saviour?
entries.61000110: I am Elizabeth, guardian of this sanctuary.
entries.61000120: Something of a godmother to Princess Dusk.
entries.61000130: I shall assist thee, to my utmost.
entries.61000140: For I am one with the sorceries of Oolacile.
entries.61000210:
We care dearly for Princess Dusk,
and are apt to blur our boundaries.
entries.61000220: I am ashamed to have been so imposing.
entries.61000230:
But should thine heart be changed,
speak to me again.
entries.61000240:
This sanctuary, and the sorceries of Oolacile,
are my domain.
entries.61000250: My strength could surely assist thee in thy travels.
entries.61000310: Such that thou might rescue dear Dusk?
entries.61000410:
But shouldst thine heart be changed,
speak to me again.
entries.61000510: What is thy wish? I offer thee my all.
entries.61000610:
If there is anything I can do,
never hesitate to ask.
entries.61000700:
I have awaited thee.
Thou hast rescued Princess Dusk,
entries.61000710:
...and rid us of that terrible primeval human.
Even halting the spread of the Abyss!
entries.61000720: I salute the grandeur of thine enterprise.
entries.61000730: Please, allow me to express my gratitude.
entries.61000740: I thank thee... as do we all.
entries.61000910:
An abyss was begat of the ancient beast, 
and threatens to swallow the whole of Oolacile.
entries.61000920:
Knight Artorias came to stop this,
but such a hero has nary a murmur of Dark.
entries.61000930:
Without doubt, he will be swallowed by the Abyss,
overcome by its utter blackness.
entries.61000950:
Still I have faith, that Princess Dusk 
may be rescued yet...
entries.61001000: Thou art from a time far, far ahead.
entries.61001010: There are many things I wish to ask.
entries.61001020: ...But I know that I must not.
entries.61001030: The perils of our time are overwhelming enough.
entries.61001100: Hah hah...Was thine eye, glancing hither?
entries.61001110: Thou needst not hide thy wonder.
entries.61001120: I am a mushroom, after all.
entries.61001200: Not long ago, I had another visitor.
entries.61001210: A human like thineself, from a far-away time.
entries.61001230: And I am afraid that he is still amongst us.
entries.61001240: He wore a hat and a long black coat...
entries.61001300:
I will remember thee,
but I will keep thy story to myself.
entries.61001310:
This is the best way,
for thou art come from a time far ahead.
entries.61001320:
No-one will sing thy praises,
but yet thy greatness shall live on.
entries.61001330:
For it shall be my purpose,
to remember all thou hast done for us.
